intro: Anthonotha sassandraensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often with fleshy, thick leaves that help it retain moisture. It thrives in humid, well-drained soil and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant. The flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
